Ontario Lakes Project: Lake Baptiste, lets crash the party, I’ll crash the plane

08 Dec 2011

 

When Ed Robertson, one of the Barenaked Ladies, crashed his float-plane Cessna 206 into Bancroft’s Lake Baptiste way back in 2008 it turned out to be a pivotal moment for the band. The crash, coupled with other unfortunate events helped bring the band together. Speaking about the band’s album All in Good Time Robertson said:

The writing was cathartic for me in a way that writing hadn’t been since the early nineties. It had been a huge and often dark year: an arrest, a plane crash and the death of my mother. All of these things took a heavy toll on my psyche, and spurred a lot of serious exploring.”

In fact, the Lake Baptiste crash inspired Robertson to write the following lyrics from the song The Love We’re In
Less heart to heart, and more brain to brain
If you’re feeling tender, I’m Novacain
Lets crash the party, I’ll crash the plane
We’re certainly glad the Cessna passengers emerged unscathed, and that one of our favorite Canadian Bands emerged better than ever.

About us

Hypenotic is a marketing strategy, design & development firm that chooses to use its powers for good. We’re a certified founding member of B Corp in Canada, and if you don’t know what that is, it’s time you do. Since ’98, we’ve helped a lot of interesting people do important things. We create relevant communications and useful experiences. Find out more.
